title: Unit 1: Friends and Family - Reading Lesson Student Handout
description: Comprehensive student materials for a 120-minute beginner-level reading lesson focusing on texts about people and families, with practice activities for the present tense of 'be', descriptive adjectives, and family vocabulary.

Activity 3: Important Words - Vocabulary (12 minutes)

These words are important for the reading text. Study them carefully.

Part A: Greetings and Introductions

Word/PhraseMeaningExample
HelloA greeting when you meet someoneHello! My name is Maria.
HiA friendly, informal greetingHi! How are you?
My name is...Used to introduce yourselfMy name is John.
I'm...Short form of "I am" (for names, descriptions)I'm Sarah. I'm 16 years old.
Nice to meet youPolite phrase when meeting someone newNice to meet you, Maria!

Part B: Family Members

WordMeaningExample
motherfemale parent (also: mum, mom)My mother is 45 years old.
fathermale parent (also: dad)My father is from Spain.
sisterfemale sibling (girl with same parents)I have one sister. She's 12.
brothermale sibling (boy with same parents)My brother is 18 years old.
parentsmother and father togetherMy parents are very kind.
familyall the people related to youMy family is big.
frienda person you like and enjoy being withSarah is my best friend.

Part C: Adjectives to Describe People

AdjectiveMeaningExample
nicepleasant, kind, goodMy teacher is very nice.
kindhelpful, caring, generousShe is kind. She helps people.
friendlyeasy to talk to, warm, welcomingThey are very friendly.
funnymakes people laugh, amusingMy brother is funny.
youngnot old, at an early ageMy sister is young. She's 10.
happyfeeling joy, pleasedI am happy today.
tallhaving great heightMy father is tall.
shortnot tall, having little heightI'm quite short.
beautifulvery pretty, attractiveMy mother is beautiful.
smartintelligent, cleverHe is very smart.

PART B: WHILE-READING ACTIVITIES (50 minutes)

THE READING TEXT: My Friends and Family

My Friends and Family

Hello! My name is Maria. I'm 17 years old and I'm from Italy. I'm from a small town called Verona. I'm a student at the local high school. I'm very happy because I have a wonderful family and great friends.

Let me tell you about my family. My family is quite big. My mother's name is Sofia. She is 42 years old. She is beautiful and very kind. She is a teacher at a primary school. My father's name is Marco. He is 45 years old. He is tall and friendly. He is a doctor. My parents are very nice. They are always happy to help people.

I have two brothers and one sister. My older brother is Antonio. He is 20 years old. He is smart and funny. He is a university student in Rome. My younger brother is Paulo. He is 14 years old. He is short but very strong. He is good at sports. My sister's name is Elena. She is 10 years old. She is young and very happy. She is always smiling!

My best friend is Sarah. Sarah is 17 years old, the same age as me. She is from England but she lives in Verona now. Sarah is my classmate at school. She is very friendly and kind. We are together every day. Sarah has a small family. She has one brother. His name is Tom and he is 15 years old. Tom is nice and funny. Sarah's parents are kind too. Her mother is a nurse and her father is an engineer.

I also have another good friend. His name is John. John is 16 years old. He is from America. John is tall and smart. He is good at math and science. John's family is in America, so he lives with his aunt in Verona. His aunt is very nice. John is sometimes sad because his family is far away, but we are always there for him. We are good friends.

I am very lucky. My family is wonderful and my friends are amazing. We are all happy together. My life in Verona is great!

PART C: POST-READING AND LANGUAGE FOCUS (45 minutes)

Grammar Reference: The Present Tense of "BE"

AFFIRMATIVE (Positive Statements)
SubjectVerb "be"Example
Iam / 'mI am a student. / I'm from Italy.
Youare / 'reYou are nice. / You're my friend.
He / She / Itis / 'sHe is tall. / She's kind. / It's big.
Weare / 'reWe are students. / We're happy.
Theyare / 'reThey are friends. / They're from Spain.
NEGATIVE (Negative Statements)
SubjectVerb "be" + notExample
Iam not / 'm notI am not tall. / I'm not a teacher.
Youare not / aren'tYou are not late. / You aren't from here.
He / She / Itis not / isn'tHe is not young. / She isn't at home.
Weare not / aren'tWe are not tired. / We aren't busy.
Theyare not / aren'tThey are not happy. / They aren't here.
QUESTIONS (Yes/No Questions)
Verb "be"SubjectExample
AmIAm I late?
AreyouAre you a student?
Ishe / she / it
